meanings.definition: A device that emits a beeping sound, typically used for communication or alert purposes.
meanings.sent1: The beepers on the alarm clock woke me up.
meanings.sent2: I heard the beepers of the microwave when my popcorn was ready.
meanings.sent3: The beepers on the oven sang a loud song when the cookies were done baking.
meanings.sent4: The beepers of the car echoed through the quiet street, signaling its arrival.
meanings.sent5: The hospital hallway was filled with the constant beepers of medical equipment.

meanings.definition: The act of emitting a series of beeping sounds.
meanings.sent1: The beepers of the truck backing up could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The beepers of the construction vehicles created a symphony of noise at the site.
meanings.sent3: The beepers of the video game intensified as the player reached a new level.
meanings.sent4: The beepers of the smoke alarm warned of potential danger in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The beepers of the robot cleaners filled the room with futuristic sounds.

meanings.definition: To use a beeper for communication or alert purposes.
meanings.sent1: I beepers my friend when I arrived at the party.
meanings.sent2: She beepers her colleagues to let them know about the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The detective beepers the team to gather for an urgent case.
meanings.sent4: He beepers his family every evening to check in and say goodnight.
meanings.sent5: The coach beepers the players to assemble for the final game strategy.
